answers.answer: I'm being induced 37 weeks exactly due to gestational hypertension (high blood pressure ) and gestational diabetes. The baby is considered full term at 37 weeks and should not need NICU from what I have been told every case is different though.

If you had the steroid shot at 27 weeks its actually worn off by 37 weeks, my Dr said the effects of the shots only last a couple weeks. But my daughter was born at 37 weeks and she did have to go in the nicu for 3 days for breathing issues, but every baby is different.
It's best if baby stays in the womb until 39 weeks to make sure babies vital organs are mature, but I know a lot of people who have had babies at 37, 38 weeks and the babies do just fine.

I agree with everyone else its just depends on baby. I had a friend who had her baby at 35 weeks and was fine but know someone else had baby at full term and had problems. Both of my kids came at 38 weeks and was fine. So it just depends
Yes case by case thing.  My baby was born at 36 weeks and came out wanting to eat! Perfectly fine and spent no time at all in the Nicu.

Thanks ladies for ur replies.@4thonecoming.should I ask my doc to give me another shot so that my baby will be safe? Should I wait untill 38 weeks?I lost my previous twins kids n now want her to be perfectly fine and healthy.

question: Is it safe for the baby to come in 37 week?does the baby need to stay in the nicu if steroids shot has been given in 27th week?
title: 37 weeks baby
